Forbes: "Jaclyn Johnson Expands The Create & Cultivate Empire Beyond The Conference"

speakerBioSummary.text:
• Jaclyn Johnson is the CEO of Create & Cultivate, one of the fastest-growing online platforms and conferences for millennial women.
  • Jaclyn just released her first book (WORKPARTY) through Simon & Schuster.
  • In the book, Jaclyn shows how she turned distrust into determination, frustration into fuel, and heartache into hard work. 
  • Additionally, Jaclyn is an investor in female-owned businesses and advisor to several start-ups.

speakerBiography.text: Jaclyn is the CEO of Create & Cultivate, one of the fastest-growing online platforms and conferences for millennial women. The conference hosts trailblazers in the fashion, technology, design, and entertainment industries. Jaclyn just released her first book (WORKPARTY) through Simon & Schuster. In the book, Jaclyn shows how she turned distrust into determination, frustration into fuel, and heartache into hard work. The book features stories from leading female entrepreneurs including Christene Barberich (co-founder of Refinery29), Alli Webb, (creator of Drybar), Morgan Debaun (founder of Blavity), Jen Gotch (Ban.do), Rebecca Minkoff, and Kendra Scott. Additionally, Jaclyn is an investor in female-owned businesses and advisor to several start-ups
